abstracts.cdata!:
The Fourth Education Project in Liberia
            was Implemented. The Bank performance was fairly good during
            the early stages of the project cycle including appraisal.
            Project supervision by the International Development
            Association (IDA) was good up to the suspension of
            disbursements. Supervision teams were able to agree with the
            Government of Liberia (GOL) on changes required to
            facilitate the smooth implementation of the project. This
            plan joins the long list of projects that encountered delays
            in their implementation schedule, due to lack of adequate
            counterpart funding. Since it is so difficult to anticipate
            periods in the life of the project when financial
            constraints might become so severe as to paralyze it, there
            is wisdom in the Bank's policy of using the given
            region's profile for determining the implementation
            schedule. Uncertainty and confusion between the Project
            Implementation Unit (PIU) and high level officials at the
            Ministry of Education (MOE) resulted from changes of
            minister, deputy minister, and senior staff of the PIU.
